summary: The Feed Our Families Act of 2025 (H.R. 2016) aims to provide emergency appropriations for the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) during a lapse in discretionary appropriations. The bill authorizes funding for the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 for the first 90 days of a government shutdown, ensuring continued program operations. The funds are to be held in reserve and used only as needed.
